{{GZM route/Line 3}} '''Line 3''' of the '''[[Guangzhou Metro]]''' ({{zh|s=å¹¿å·å°é3å·çº¿|p=GuÇngzhÅu DÃ¬tiÄ SÄn HÃ o XiÃ n}}) or '''Southern-Northern Express Line''' ({{zh|s=ååå¿«çº¿|p=NÃ¡n BÄi KuÃ i XiÃ n}}) is a 67.3-kilometer Y-shape line connecting [[Tianhe Coach Terminal Station|Tianhe Coach Terminal]] to [[Panyu Square Station|Panyu Square]]. Currentl all stations are [[rapid transit|underground]].[http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/english/doc/2005-12/26/content_506614.htm Fastest advanced metro starts service] Line 3 is split into two sections '''Shiqiao Line''' ({{zh|s=å¸æ¡¥çº¿|p=ShÃ¬qiÃ¡o XiÃ n}}) and '''Airport Line'''({{zh|s=æºåºçº¿|p=JÄ«chÇng XiÃ n}}) and brand with same color: '''orange'''. As of September 21, 2010 a date has been set for the trial run of the Line 3 extension to Airport South station from Guangzhou East Railway station. The extension has started trial runs on October 30, 2010. http://www.newsgd.com/news/GDNews/content/2010-09/21/content_16097728.htm * December 26, 2005: [[Guangzhou East Railway Station (metro)|Guangzhou East Railway Station]] - [[Kecun Station|Kecun]] * December 30, 2006: Kecun - Panyu Square * December 30, 2006: Tianhe Coach Terminal - [[Tiyu Xilu Station|Tiyu Xilu]] * October 30, 2010: Guangzhou East Railway Station - [[Airport South Station (Guangzhou)|Airport South]] ==Stations== ===Northern Line=== {| class="wikitable" |
